page.title: 05THE MARLBOROUGH MARKET
page.content:
On Wednesdays and Saturdays there is a market in town, in the middle of the High Street. The Wednesday market has 18 stalls; 11 of these come in on Saturday as well. There are 8 others which come on Saturday, making 19. The stalls include fish, eggs, cheese, greengrocery, junk, wool, household goods, flowers, plants, cakes, clothes, jewellery, leather goods, haberdashery, second hand clothes and double glazing.
The second hand clothes are clothes that babies have grown out of, etc.
There is a man who sells fish. He comes from Brixham, and goes to seven other markets.
